$block: The Ping resource is a collection of pings that have been sent to monitors in the user account.

$ul: **alertLogs**: The alert logs that are related to this resource instance.
**createdAt**: When the resource instance was created. This date-time is in the UTC timezone.
**dataSegmentCode**: User-provided string on which to segment and filter data. Max 50 characters.

**expectNextPingAt**: When to expect the next ping for a Last Ping monitor type. This date-time is always interpreted to be in the timezone of the monitor. Any UTC offset is ignored. Supply either "expectNextPingAt", or "expectNextPingAtEpoch", or a X_NEXT_PING request header, not more than one of those options. Must be blank for other monitor types.

**expectNextPingAtEpoch**: When to expect the next ping for a Last Ping monitor type, expressed in epoch timestamp format. Supply either "expectNextPingAt", or "expectNextPingAtEpoch", or a X_NEXT_PING request header, not more than one of those options. Must be blank for other monitor types.
**id**: The unique identifier of the resource instance.
**ipAddress**: The IP address where this resource originated.
**monitor**: The monitor that is related to this resource instance.
**monitorStatusLog**: The monitor status that resulted from the ping.
**partition**: The partition that contains this resource instance. The resource cannot be moved to another partition.
**pingCustomCode**: The client-supplied custom code that is appended to the ping. Only the first 10 characters are used and saved.

**pingCustomPayload**: The client-supplied custom payload that is saved with the ping. Only the first 100 characters are saved. This value overrides the value of an monitor's alert payload, if the ping results in an alert.
**resourceOwner**: The name of the person who owns this resource.
